While hot they were delicious once cold I threw half away , same for the sweet potato fries, the coleslaw was bland and vinegary ! The real star is the chicken !! Maybe get sides at wahlburger or one of the other restaurants in the bazaar shops?  But I would definitely go back just for the chicken and chicken sandwiches !!

The best chicken I can recall I've had in many months! Those hush puppies were the best ever!! I wanted to sneak all those flavored honey bottles but my purse was too small lol... I may try to buy a franchise! It was that good!

Since everyone was going crazy over this chicken, I figured I needed to try it! So, I brought my friend from out of town to eat for dinner.   The location itself is perfect if you're on the Strip. It's tucked away in the Bally's Bazaar. There are a few table seats and a bar seating area. It was relatively small, so we had to eagle-eye for a table. There was a sauce station in the corner and sauces on every table.   I ordered the AM-PM sandwich, which is the January special of the month. It was very good. The chicken was actually fantastic. It was extremely tasty and full of flavor.   The three star review is entirely because of the service. I would give one star for the staff, but the food was too good. So, they entirely messed up my order. I ordered the AM-PM sandwich, the Rancher, a side of corn bacon, a small beer, and a large drink. They gave me mac-n-cheese instead of the corn bacon. They charged me for a large beer ($15!) and forgot the large drink entirely, even though they charged me for it. I figured since the beer was already poured, I would just drink it. I mean, more beer is always fine with me. I think my friend got a different sandwich than he ordered, but he was fine with whatever at that point. The food took a long time, so I didn't even bother complaining about the mistakes in the food. Just not sure how so many things were incorrect from my order.   It was pretty expensive for being chicken sandwiches. The total for the above order was $45. However, I understand that it was on the Strip and the alcohol alone was $15. So, it was okay. I would say the prices are comparable for Strip prices. Just not sure I would pay for it again.   Overall, the food was great. Pricey, but great. The staff was very disappointing. I would give this place another shot but probably at the Summerlin location.

I work at Wahlburgers right next door so I come here a lot during my lunch break. While I haven't tried a lot on the menu yet I can easily say this is the best fried chicken I've ever had. I've never loved fried chicken, but I find myself craving this place. It's pricey for sure but it's also on the strip. I like that they let me have extra fries instead of the coleslaw. They also have some good dipping sauces. Their homemade ranch is really good and their chipotle honey is so delicious. I'm so glad this place opened up next to my job.

I'm sorry to say I have a very disappointing review, based on the other reviews I thought this would be good.   We ordered sides of the smoked Mac and cheese. They were out. So we ordered sweet potato and loaded fries.   Were they good? I have no idea. They screwed up my sandwich (the rancher) by not adding the extra cheese I paid for or any ranch on it. By the time I got it corrected, fries were soggy and cold.   Hope your experience is better. We would not give this place another try

Who doesn't love a chicken sandwich.. especially when it's bigger than your mouth! There are multiple locations but the location on the strip is perfect for a meal after a night out. They have indoor and outdoor seating if you need some fresh air. The Bloody Mary was amazing and I highly recommend! The best part is you can always take it to go if you don't finish before your meal. There are many sandwich options and I don't think you could go wrong. The proportions are big but don't forget to add a side of fries. They also have a few different sauces you can add which are on the tables The range in flavor and spices. Don't pass this place up when you're on the strip!

I love that the chicken is all natural! This place is really passionate about using natural ingredients in their cooking and beverages. Mike at the strip location was soo nice, informative and hospitable.

Strolling the strip a few weeks ago and it was hot. Real hot. I needed some comfort food as the night before was a good but long one. So fried chicken was on my menu. I usually hit up Popeyes, but I'm in Vegas, i can have Popeyes anywhere. And lets be honest, that can always be hit or miss depending on which one you go to. Blue Ribbon was amazing! Great quality big pieces of chicken and fried to perfection! Im a thigh man so i devoured two pieces & some bomb mac n cheese. I struck up a conversation with the store manager to get some info about their history and he couldn't have been more friendly and insightful. Gave me their history and even showed me how to properly mix the various honeys & hot sauces to get the maximum signature flavor. Next time im on the strip im definitely going back! They even have a walk up bar so you can walk the strip with a PBR and a drumstick in your hand lol

Damn good fried chicken. One of my friends made it a point to stop by this place during our most recent trip to Vegas and it was the perfect midday meal before transitioning into nightlife mode.   Everything was delicious, so it doesn't matter if you went with the chicken tenders, the wings, or a chicken sandwich. Pieces were seasoned well and  breaded perfectly with just enough crunch on the outside, but soft and tender on the inside.   It was early February at the time and it was hot as hell inside. I don't know if the ac wasn't working but if the temperature is like that all year round, you might want to eat outside or get your food to go.
Great place! The chicken has great flavor, it's a little hidden gem  you won't regret going and the price are not to bad either

* If you're having trouble finding this place - it's in the rows of shops outside Bally's, known as the Grand Bazaar. This is a popular stop in New York, and I'm happy to see it on The Strip (.. and Summerlin)!  Basics: - Order at the counter and sit down or take it to go - Price Range / Person: $12 - $18 (without alcohol) - Any meal listed + side should fill you up - Classics include drumsticks and the Firebird sandwich (there are also seasonal specials not-so-obviously posted around) - Their sauces are great to amplify flavor profile that you enjoy  Critiques of this location:  - The buns on my sandwich was cold and flavorless; it seriously put a damper on my meal, so I just took them off - No one wiping down the tables consistently; did not happen in the hour that I was there

What i dont get is why dont a lot of peeps know about this place? Shame on them cuz they be missing out on a gold chicken mine. Got my usual firebird and fries which taste exactly how it has in the past. This shows the consistency of their food, unlike some places where it may be good one day but bad the next. Normally i only eat at a place once during a trip, but last week i came here twice cuz its that damn good. #blueribbonchickenarmyYO

Look, folks, you're in Vegas: Even when buying fried chicken, the deck is stacked against you. But that doesn't mean loosing cannot be fun, or delicious! After an evening of drinking rum and coke, a little blue ribbon fried chicken and side of mac'n cheese was the perfect companion to bring back to my room (and certainly not the most expensive, unhealthy alternative).

We tried this place for the first time today while we were on vacation in Las Vegas. This place is absolutely delicious if you're looking for an over the top chicken place. We had the sandwiches, mine was a special with chopped bacon, BBQ sauce, cheddar, and macaroni and cheese.. My bf had the one with bacon and ranch. We also got the loaded fries with chopped bacon, sour cream, and cheese.. It was all delicious but it is also a billion calories..

Great fried chicken and cheap by Vegas standards!  Super crispy, super juicy.  Nicely seasoned as well.  I'm not a sauce-on-fried-chicken-guy but they had an assortment of BBQ sauces and honey.  Definitely worth a visit for a snack, especially when the post-imbibing munchies hit!
Delicious shoe string fries! I could not stop eating them. The chicken treated fresh and moist with a light breading and seasoning. Free dipping sauce as well. A little pricey but still great good!

We stumbled up on this spot while walking down the strip and the food was good.  I enjoyed the chicken strips and fries.  Good flavor and many other good choices. Only 2 chicken strips though, need to add 1 more to make this meal complete. the service was good also.

Best chicken fingers I've ever had. Customer service can be hit and miss sometimes. Sometimes they're super nice and inviting other times it seems as if they don't care but over all real good chicken!

Delicious fired chicken. I had breast, wing large slaw and cold beer. Awesome. The chicken spice was really good. I but bbq and honey wasabi sauce on side for dipping. So good. I highly recommend. I will be back. Please open one of these joints in San Jose you will make a killing.
We walked by here looking for the Lush store. My girlfriend love chicken so what the heck. We ended up destroying the chicken, it was fantastic. The fries are also splendid, the portion was huge.

This is becoming my bad habit. Ordering the chicken tenders allows me to sop up all the Chipotle honey sauce I desire, without being asked to leave. This makes a great cheat meal if you're on some sort of calorie-restricted diet.

Locals tend to stir away from the strip except for special events or shows... I'm not one of them. So, as someone that loves the chaos of the LV Blvd, it is frustrating to go some of the strip area restaurants only to be disappointed that quality and taste is not high priority... I'm guessing, gearing towards tourist and not for repeat customers. BLUE RIBBON FRIED CHICKEN is not one of those overpriced and underwhelming tourist trap. This fast casual place is not only, over the top with customer service, the atmosphere is modern and comfortable and the food is absolutely delicious at affordably prices. We have had the whole pieces of fried chicken and the chicken strips. Both, are equally as good. The fries are addictive. Looking forward to trying the mac n cheese on our next visit. I can't stress enough, how this place really is worth the wait. They also have adult spirits which is a nice plus! By far, the BEST Blood Mary I have had since being in Vegas. YES, for real! Listen, the Grand Bazaar area is full of tourist trap restaurants... trust me, I been to them all. This really is the only one worth the walk.

Long wait for dry chicken, thin greasy fries. Refused refills on soda which made it impossible to finish the dry chicken.  Took most of it in a to go box, but never brought myself to finish it so now it is in the trash.  Very expensive for what it is.

Not really a fan of there oily chicken. Fries were the string size. Nothing special about the fatty chicken. Seems like battered and fried then some Cajun seasoning. For a quick bite, then ok, but there is a lot of people that are eating in this place.
VIVA las chicken. Probably the best fried chicken in Las Vegas. Fantastic service as well. There was a slight hiccup with my order, and the situation was rectified 10 fold. Go eat some CHICKEN!!!

This place was a bit pricey but I believe worth the price.  Chicken was crispy, moist, meaty & delicious .  You are given a huge pile of hot crispy shoe string fries . Added flavor profile honey sauce at the table in squeeze bottles.
This.Chicken.Be.Poppin. Every bite is seasoned to perfection. Whatever sauce they use on these sandwiches...BOMB xoxo EatWithReese
Indeed the best fried chicken I've ever had in US, period. The only problem is that it is tooooo crowded! And the service speed suffers from that.

Ordering is fast. But long wait. Waited 30 min for our food. Order was so disorganized. I don't get why. Order was messed up. Just for tender and fries... didn't get the fries. Friend got a burger which was cold. Not coming back.

This place was okay.  I've been to both this location and the one in downtown Summerlin.  Both places were fine but failed to impress.    There was limited outdoor and indoor seating.  I could see it being a problem in the colder months.  Service was great, and the employees in the front and servers were all pleasant.  I ended up getting the dark chicken combo.  For both locations, the chicken was whelming, while the fries were super tasty.  I wouldn't come back though, when there's a multitude of low cost comfort food places around the strip and around town.  If you're near either location and want fried chicken, it's not a bad bet.  Otherwise, I'd make the drive to Raisin Cane's for both price, quantity and flavor.

The food here was good, and for the amount you get wasn't too expensive. The chicken tenders were a bit on the dry side, but the flavor was still solid. Will probably try the dark meat combo next time. The Fries with The Works are what will be bringing me back, though. Not shy with the toppings at all, and somehow the fries managed to stay crispy. The inside is super tiny, so not great for big groups.

This is some good chicken. Popeye's who? We landed and checked into the room and came out to get some lunch. Coming down the escalators of Bally's, you'll see the Blue Ribbon sign. My brother and I both said we heard this was good, so we ate here.  We got the 4 piece mix - Wow, nice seasoning and the breast meat was actually moist. Plenty of skinny fries. I wasn't a fan of the cole slaw though...needs work too me.  We came back the last day of our trip and ended up getting the 6 piece wings. Nice size and still yummy!  Would definitely be back!
Very good food, I had the firebird & the chicken breast was perfectly cooked, moist, juicy & flavorful! The toppings worked perfectly together. The shoestring fries are AMAZING too!

Love the food here!!   Located at the Bazaar in front of Starbucks, this cute chicken restaurant is a great place to stop in and get something quick and delicious to eat.   I came here last weekend and got the Cheesy Supreme chicken sandwich and the Fries with the works. They made it a combo, so it also came with a small coleslaw and I got a lemonade. The portions are much larger than I expected, so I wasn't able to finish everything and ended up sharing my fries.   The chicken sandwich came with 2 choices of cheese on the crispy chicken piece along with lettuce and tomato and their special sauce. Fries are made of cheddar, bacon and sour cream..can I say YUM!! Both the chicken sandwich and fries were delicious and I would definitely get them again.   Inside the restaurant, there are plenty of seating for you and a guest, but it's not big enough to have large groups of people. There are tables outside for those that have bigger groups of people eating here. Each of the inside tables has a collection of hot sauces and flavored honey as well as the hot sauce bar.   Employees here are very friendly and accommodating.

You know it's a good sandwich when you have more chicken then bread lol.  The chicken was juicy, fresh and filling. The bread was soft and light. The toppings were cut fresh and the pickle tasted homemade.  Add a side of sweet potato fries and cole slaw for $2.  They are definitely known for their juicy chicken but their honey based sauce selection tops it off. Wasabi Honey and Chipotle Honey were my favorite. You will walk away perfectly full and satisfied.  Only downside is the drinks are not refillable the milkshake tasted like soft serve but was pricey.  Just go for the chicken!
These by far are the best chicken wings and sandwich I've had in my life. Seriously, I came back twice in one day. Tiffany is the best bar tender and was awesome.
The fried chicken was on point, crispy and fresh. French fries were thin cut and delicious. Service was exceptional.

Nommmm! I have a thing for fried chicken! Located at the Grand Bazaar Shops outside of Bally's Hotel.  Their fried chicken is crispy and seasoned very well. Also have unique sauces. The tangy BBQ one is lit! Should've took a bottle to go to dip my Popeyes Chicken in (Since there's no Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken where I live lol)

Overall chicken was ok and the fries was awesome. I ordered the "beak to butt" which is supposed to be chef's choice. It basically has everything but chicken meat. I thought it'd be interesting to try other part of chicken fried. But, I was a little disappointed. The seasoning was good, but the chicken was too greasy. After a few bites I felt it was simply too much oil to eat. I had to throw out half of it. I'm curious to try other things on the menu, i.e. the ones with actual meat not the neck or butt.
Super crispy hot juicy and moist chicken that tastes great. Quick service and this place is always packed.

The food is pretty good but it is way too expensive for fast food. Even for the Strip. $16 for four pieces of fried chicken? $13 for a chicken sandwich? No thanks. The inside is very small and there are a few tables outside too. Maybe just try cleaning them once in a while!
The food is ok at best. Looks better than it actually is. If it wasn't so expensive then it would be worth it. The price doesn't justify the quality of food for me

Chicken was just ok. Good flavor, but just didn't have that crispy fried chicken texture. Fries were really good.  Skinny and crispy with lots of flavor. The price was kind of expensive...$10 for 2 small drumsticks and fries.  Disappointing.
Food here was good, and tastes fresh. The perfect meal after our Happy Hour on the High Roller.

I really have mixed emotions about this place. I heard about it from a personality on the Food Network so I thought it was a must have. Therefore, I made the trip.  Upon walking in it is loud and a bit small but there is seating outside. The next thing I noticed were the prices. There were close to Five Guys prices and it was over $30 for a beer, fries, two sandwiches and hush puppies. The sum of my Ranch sandwich was not impressive. It was a bit too much bread and I attribute this to the thin piece of chicken that was in it. It was much thinner than a Chik Fil A patty. The chicken was tasty so I would do a leg or breast the next time I visit if I do again. The fries were good but standard at best.   After leaving here, I felt underwhelmed. I feel it was overpriced and under portioned.

Got here with my girlfriend, $8 for burger, and $5 for fries with works (small). we ordered the one with cheese, and another one with  hot pepper. Some people will think that it is too expensive 8 dollars for a single sandwich, but I kind of felt that the price was reasonable. When you go onto Jack in the Box, you will expect to pay around 6-7 dollars for a sandwich. If I think about that, since this place is in Strip and the chicken was fresh too. We enjoyed our time there, food was great, there are seats outside too, so you may be able to get some breeze while you are eating there.

Yummy yummy! After seeing countless posts on Instagram about this place, we decided to stop in! Hungover and hungry, we were so glad there wasn't a line on Thu afternoon. We tried the original sandwich and the firebird - both were delicious! Firebird has a little kick to it. Their fried are so good! String fries that are crispy have a special place in my heart!
Great wing, just enough seasoning and mild enough to enjoy. Ate at the bar and service was awesome. Employee treat you like family.

Found this place on IG and after seeing the pictures I had to try it. I had a Hibiscus margarita. Fire bird sandwich filled with lettuce peppers spicy mayo cucumbers and tomatoes  it wasn't to spicy you felt the heat when you took a bite of the peppers and the cucumbers gave it a cooling effect, I added hot sauce to mine. Everything fries, had cheese bacon and sour cream. Mac and cheese and a chicken strip so we could try all of the different honey flavors. Definitely recommend and I can't wait to go back

Went on a whim and went to Blue Ribbon after a night out, and it was the best decision we have ever made! The special sauce is amazing, as well as the smoked mac n cheese. The service was fast, and the employees were friendly. 10/10 would recommend this to anyone walking down the strip!
This place is the best chicken spot that I have ever been to! The chicken is so flavorful. It's easily the best that I have ever tasted! Nothing is comparable. It is definitely a must try!

First place my girlfriend and I ate with some friends when we got to Vegas, got a recommendation to check this place out for their chicken. Order the chicken sandwich and the girlfriend got the two piece chicken plate. cole slaw was okay, chicken itself was moist and juicy, not dry at all. sandwich was delicious, the sauces were delicious you can fill your little cups. overall pretty good for what it is. Would definitely recommend.

Great flavor! A little pricey, but everything on the strip is expensive FYI.... The chicken had tons of flavor packed into each bite! I didn't want the experience to end. The fries were good too. I like their sauce selection. All of their sauces have a honey base, delicious.

I heard this was one good fried chicken spot from my folks in NYC. So while here in Vegas, I decided to give it a try. And it did not disappoint. Shoe string fries cooked the way I like them, crispy until the last fey; even with ketchup on it. Chicken was cooked well, succulent, juicy, crispy and flavorful. The hush puppies too were on point. Pieces of what looked like corn and carrots in them.  They have a variety of sweet sauces that go with everything. Over all, this was a great place, staff was very friendly too.

DAY:  - Saturday for lunch.  LOCATION/INTERIOR:  - located in the shopping area right outside of Bally's.  - they have seating inside and outside.  ORDER & TASTE: * You order first then they will give you a buzzer for when your order is ready.  When you pay with card, there is a prompt to tip - I don't appreciate this system especially because of the service I received. I don't think they served the tip.  The girl taking the order was not friendly.   - 2 pc tenders ($9.95): this is the combo that comes with fries and coleslaw. Chicken itself was okay, wasn't dry so that was at least good. But presentation was terrible. If you like the thin strongly fries, it is pretty good. It was crispy. Still think it was expensive for the 2pc.  - fries the works small ($7.75): I honestly didn't think this was with it at all. It didn't like very appetizing and it was super oily.  Don't waste your money.  * For the price, didn't think the food was worth it.  CUSTOMER SERVICE:  - was disorganized and did not seem like they had a system at all.  - waited forever for our food. Which is stupid since they already have stuff ready.   - once we got it, it wasn't event correct. Had to go back inside to get the missing item from our order.

Definitely one of the best fried chicken eateries in Las Vegas! I've been here several times and the 30 minute drive is worth it. The parking lot is huge but good luck finding a close spot, just forget driving in circles and head to the back. What gets me is the people inside always appear to be people watching as you walk past the big glass windows.  The menu is simple. Get fried chicken or a chicken sandwich. Both are spectacular. Definitely try the fries with the works. I always order the blue ribbon sandwich with cheddar and an extra patty (huge but delicious). The sauces are OK. Seating has never been a problem, but the seats themselves I hate. They're like sticky picnic tables. You cannot wipe them down enough! Despite always leaving full and guilty about the huge caloric intake....I always come back.

Oh. My. God.  I always like to ask the people that work there what they like because they usually know what's good. I tried the blue ribbon sandwich and the rancher sandwich with the loaded fries and woah that was a party in my mouth. My boyfriend and I ate everything. I hate pickles but even the pickles were good. The staff was super friendly and helpful too

Best fried chicken and fries I've ever had! Huge sandwiches! Delicious sauces! Smoky barbecue is my favorite. Great coleslaw! Friendly staff, little wait time, and great food. This is our new go-to spot before a night of drinking in Vegas! Also... fantastic music: retro, 80s pop type!

Such a great place to get delicious fried chicken and fries! My two favorite food!   Their style of fried chicken is deliciously seasoned and fried to perfection. It's crispy, golden brown, and moist, like how fried chicken should be. Their fries are thin, battered and crispy. The food goes so well with each other and it's the best comfort food you can get on the strip!  Try the chicken and fries with their honey sauces: wasabi or wildflower. Both honey are good, even the wasabi one was delicious (that's coming from someone who hates wasabi!)  This location is in the Grand Bazaar at Bally's, which is a new development of modern restaurants and shops that are open late. We came here around midnight and they were still open and happy to serve customers.   Apparently this brand is famous in NYC and Vegas, but being from California this is the first time we tried it since we were in Vegas during NYE weekend.  When I come back to Vegas, I'll hit this place up again and try other combos on the menu.

I came here for a late midnight snack/dinner since they were open until 2am. I'm glad it was still open because it satisfied my savory cravings. I ordered the chicken wings with fries. The outer skin of the wings were crispy which is the way I love my wings. Fries were thinly sliced and soft. All went well with the Chipotle honey sauce: sweet with a kick of spice. I am taking 1 star away because there were napkins and garbage on the floor when I walked into the restaurant. I believe all restaurants should maintain a level of cleanliness, even if they are considered fast food restaurants.
Man everyone talks about Yardbird but this place is on a whole entire level better then them
The firebird was the perfect kick! The spiciness was just enough to keep you holding on to a cup of water with the other hand. Nice quick meal on the strip overall.

The chicken was good but it didn't really feel like a nice crunch or flaky or anything. Also the bread falls apart kind of easy and takes away from the sandwich. That was all okay to deal with but i also had the cheesy supreme and with a name like that I figured it had a lot of cheese but it didn't. It was 2 choices of cheese and it was an ok amount.  However, the loaded fries were amazing! Plenty of cheese and nice bacon but the addition of he sour cream it brings was soo good!   Prices were good with everything being at about $8 or $9 but honestly for a place known for the chicken, I was blown away by the fries and the chicken was just good to me. Worth trying but not sure of worth repeating. Maybe getting chicken pieces and not sandwiches would be better
Best chicken sandwich in the history of chicken sandwiches. Chick-Fil-A can go piss up a rope. This place is where it's at.

Mmmm delicious fried chicken and fries!! My friends and I landed in Vegas at around 9:30pm and were starving and wanted some quick, cheap, but good eats for the night. We stopped by this place and were all very satisfied. I got the chicken sandwich, and it was very flavorful. The chicken was well-seasoned and crispy. The sauces were also really good - I enjoyed the wasabi honey and chipotle honey. My friends got the chicken only (drums, wings, thighs), and also really enjoyed their meal. We all loved the thin, crispy fries! Overall, a great, affordable choice for a quick meal!

Blue Ribbons fried chicken has a pedigree to its sandwich but personally is hard to rate. If you don't mind paying extra for fast food than you're loving this spot. For two crispy sandwich meals it came out to $30. I felt that was kind of steep.The sandwiches were good but idk if it's a must have. It's more of an alternative goto.   I would give it a 3 1/2 stars
Delicious chicken platters a little pricey but decent amount. 3 tender platter $13. I ate hush puppies and the smokehouse MAC and it was great.

I had very high expectations of this place and that did not help...  The chicken was okay and not the best fried chicken I've ever had.  The best part about this place is the honey... lots and lots of honey.  Different kinds and no limits (other than it takes a long time to pour honey).  The fries were good (a great way to scoop up more honey) but oddly way more than you would need.  I will give it another chance, but I don't have high hopes that it will beat Yardbird for Fried Chicken on the Strip anytime soon...  Ordered: Kerry's Classic The Drum Line w/ Sweet Potato Fries (two drumsticks)  Overall: Worth the try because of the hype, but if you really just want Fried Chicken you might want to check out Yardbird instead

Passed by Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken while we were exiting Bally's (next to Starbucks), and made a mental note to try one day.   We passed by again, and ordered The Drumline ($9.95 2 drumstick combo) and The Wingman ($7.95 2 wing combo). All combos come with side of fries and cole slaw. Chicken was well seasoned and crispy, but the chicken to fries ratio is unbalanced. If you're actually hungry, you'll definitely need to order more chicken or try a sandwich. Love their skinny fries and slaw.  They had a good selection of sauces for your chicken, but the bbq was my favorite.   I'd definitely want to try their main restaurant at the Cosmo next time.
BOMB BOMB BOMB  Servers are extremely friendly and knowledgeable. Chicken is crispy and juicy.  Mac and cheese is on point.  Only negative is their soda was a bit flat.   Will be coming back again!

I ordered chicken tenders and they gave me something different, they gave me attitude about getting my order wrong, then charged me more to give me what I actually ordered, came out dry, and tasted horrible. Don't recommend. Bad food.

There aren't a lot of semi-affordable options on the Strip that don't have wait times, so for that, Blue Ribbon serves a purpose. I love me some fried chicken, but I didn't think Blue Ribbon was spectacular by any stretch of the imagination.   The fries are good, and the chicken is solid (lots of pepper flavor!), but it's not lifechanging. The inside of the restaurant was pretty messy when we went (they're busy, I get it, but no one was cleaning up trays that looked like they had been sitting on tables for a while). The staff was also pretty unprofessional; any staff at a Shake Shack or In-n-Out would make this place look like McDonald's in terms of service.  If you've never been to a Blue Ribbon before, this is an "order at the counter place" that's pretty narrow inside and ultimately looks like a fast food restaurant (because it is). The chicken sits under lights, and they quickly grab it with tongs and give it to you. You can get food pretty fast as a result, but it's still hardly an upscale fast food place, which you'd expect after spending close to $20/person.   That being said, it serves a purpose. You can get food fast, and it has a lot of bready goodness. It's not fancy, but the fries are bomb, and the chicken is better than most fast food places. Is it worth going out of your way for? I'd say no, but if the craving hits and you just want something simple, it's worth a look.

My husband and I stopped by for a late night meal after watching a show. It was Sunday night after 11 pm and there were quite a few people here. We ordered the 4 whole wings meal which comes with the wings, a huge portion of fries, and a small side of coleslaw. The fried chicken was only ok. It's definitely better than fast food chains but not the best I've had. The skin was crispy but there wasn't much flavor. I also wish they gave a larger portion of coleslaw to balance out the oil from the chicken and the fries. The only downside to this place was there was literally no more sauces out on the table and their sauce station had a lot of empty bottles. Overall, it was a decent late night meal but I probably would choose something else next time.

Okay I'm not sure if I was really hungry after my stroll down on the Vegas strip or what, but their fried chicken was so good!! Hey, we all know what fried chicken tastes like and will know a great one from a mediocre ones!!  They know how to produce good fried chicken that is moist, seasoned well, & fried well. All the sauces were awesome - my fav was the chipotle honey sauce! The lady who is in the front (young black lady) was so friendly! She was such a doll.  If you are looking for a lunch spot walking down the strip, make sure you check this place out! They truly deserve the blue ribbon for their fried chicken~
Went with three cheesy supreme after reading reviews and it did not let down, very pleased. The "Fries with the Works" were excellent.

Best fried chicken I've had to date. The crispiness on the outside and juiciness on the inside with the perfect seasoning is the ultimate recipe. Vegas has so many great places to eat and I ate there 4 times in 3 days. Gonna miss you Blue Ribbon.

I hate giving a 2-star review. Majority of the deduction is due to the fact that I waiting around 30-minutes for 1-thigh and 1-drumstick. That's only 2 pieces of chicken. Went around 9:00PM and although there were several orders ahead of me, there was always chicken that was available that I saw on the rack. I'm not sure if orders are done in actual order, so I had to wait for them to come to mine. But if an order is small, such as mine, I'd think you'd get to that and move on to the next one.  I really wanted to try this place, since I heard the chicken was pretty good. And although I'm not going to say the chicken is junk, I wasn't wowed or ever thought to myself that I'd really want to come back because the flavor was unique or something I'd crave. To me, it was a one and done type of thing. And I hate saying that of any business. Flavor was good, but that's about it. Maybe the pieces that I had were flavored inconsistently? I'm not sure. But I did notice that a seasoning is shaked onto the chicken. Maybe mine wasn't addressed as much. And that's all that I think. Just so-so in flavor. Perhaps I *might* give them another chance, but only if I'm around the area.

The chicken taste great! Service is a little slow and prices are okay. Fries are also really tasty shoestring cut. The coleslaw is good but a small portion size of you order to go! I really like this place but am only giving three stars for the extremely slow service.

By far one of hands down best chicken sandwiches (chicken period for that matter) I have ever had in my entire life. The prices here are extremely generous for the quality of food they serve. Seating is limited however we went during lunch time during the week and had no issue getting a table outside in the cool breeze. Employees were very friendly/welcoming. Do yourself a favor and grab a Firebird sandwich to jump start your metabolism for all the alcohol consumption you will be doing.

I don't give a lot of 5-star reviews but every bite was better than the last at BRFC. Unreal delicious. I love fried chicken/chicken tenders etc, and these are the best of the best. Super juicy, amazing flavor. They look spicy/hot but they're not; they're just perfectly seasoned. You won't get a crunch like a battered tender, but instead it's almost like a crispy skin. The fries are good, but if you have to choose one side, opt for the smoked macaroni and cheese. I have no idea what kind of cheese they use, but it'll be my life mission to replicate this. O. M. G. 10/10 would order again. My husband got The Rancher and raved about it. Add this to your must-visit list in Vegas.

My new Fried Chicken FAVORITE!  OK so my hubby and I came into the strip on Saturday night and had parked at Bally's (note: it's not free parking-we paid $7 for a few hours)  Anywhoo with no intention of going out to eat, we saw this shop on the way down the escalators and thought why not as we'd heard great thing about it from the Yelp Elite crew that went (I missed out)  And I'm so glad we did!   We weren't starving - so I ordered the 1 wing and hubby got the thigh or was it breast... whatever it was he loved it. Thick and juicy - lol!  I love love the seasoning and my wing was perfect and moist too!   With it I ordered the Moscato and Modelo 24oz can and we were set!   Food was FABULOUS! Service was SENSATIONAL!  Staff were spot on service and you weren't standing around guessing. They were all very cool!   Thank you! We'll be back for sure!

Every time I visit this place I'm blown away by the quality of their food and service. Having never been a fan of fried-chicken *gasp* outside of a chicken finger basket Blue Ribbon won me over with their crispy skin and juicy interior.   The Firebird is one of my favorite sandwiches. You can win me over with any variation on a chipotle sauce. I am also a big fan of their Kale Salad. I was a bit wary of it because just about everyone is doing a kale something or other on their menu. The salad was a nice mix of healthy crunch with the fried chicken I was enjoying.  The food comes out fast, they serve Boylan natural sodas, and cocktails on draft. Their draft beer selection is a nice mix of national and local and might I recommend the Hazelberry boozy milkshake. It's a blend of Nutella and Chambord.   I have yet to visit this location into the wee hours, but they are open until 2am. As if that's not reason enough to give this place five stars!
Hell Yeah.  Moist, crispy chicken.  Great fries, thick shakes.  This is the ultimate in late night comfort food

Love the fried chicken here and I've been here twice. My favorite is the thighs which you can order individually if you don't want the combo. They have a combo that includes hearts and gizzards as well as a plate of chicken lovers with onions. I plan on trying those next time.

When we went to Vegas. We couldn't help but eat here four times. They have the best chicken and fries as well as dozens of choices to choose from. We have zero complaints and the service here was literally Outstanding. They went above and beyond for not only us but everyone around us each time we went. I truly wish they would open one in Orlando because we would be there all the time. You will not regret going here.

This chicken is so good !!!! I got the 4 piece to share between 2 people and it was enough especially if you've been drinking. Then the next day got the 2 piece with and extra wing added. It was great! Come with fries and coleslaw which is very tart and not to good.  Bf got the chicken sandwich he said it was great too. They have a spicy honey sauce Over the chicken. Can't wait to come back to Vegas to visit here again. Staff is super friendly. There's a red head girl she was some helpful and nice !!

This place was amazing! I had the Blue Ribbon chicken sandwich with fries and was blown away by the taste of it. The chicken was moist, well seasoned, excellent breading. The condiments on the sandwich added to the flavor. Love this place and will go again when I am back to Vegas.
